item.title: Clare add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Clare add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "I know but one freedom, and that is the freedom of the mind." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Clare add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Clare add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment." -- Rumi

item.title: Clare add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Clare add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "What saves a man is to take a step. Then another step." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Clare add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
Clare add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Do not feel lonely, the entire universe is inside you." -- Rumi

item.title: Clare add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Like so many Americans, she was trying to construct a life that made sense from things she found in gift shops." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Clare add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "To forget a friend is sad. Not everyone has had a friend." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Clare add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "Live by the harmless untruths that make you brave and kind and healthy and happy." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Clare add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "A thousand half-loves must be forsaken to take one whole heart home." -- Rumi

item.title: Clare add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Grown-ups love figures... When you tell them you've made a new friend they never ask you any questions about essential matters. They never say to you "What does his voice sound like? What games does he love best? Does he collect butterflies? " Instead they demand "How old is he? How much does he weigh? How much money does his father make? " Only from these figures do they think they have learned anything about him." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Clare add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Kilgore Trout once wrote a short story which was a dialogue between two pieces of yeast. They were discussing the possible purposes of life as they ate sugar and suffocated in their own excrement. Because of their limited intelligence, they never came close to guessing that they were making champagne." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Clare add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupery
item.description: "He who must travel happily must travel light." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupery
